quotes.quote: Your life is a print-out of your thoughts.
The power is to set the agenda. What we print and what we don't print matter a lot.
The digital print is becoming the look of our time, and it makes the C-print start to look like a tintype.
The flood of print has turned reading into a process of gulping rather than savoring.
Nothing in fine print is ever good news.
History is simply a piece of paper covered with print: the main thing is to make history, not to write it.
You can't stop people printing what they want to print.
Print encourages a sense of closure, a sense that what is found in a text has been finalized, has reached a state of completion.
You can print money to bail out a bank, but you can't print life to bail out a planet.
The large print giveth and the small print taketh away.
Don't follow in any footprints, make your own prints. Because, you are the future of tomorrow.
If you do big things they print your face, and if you do little things they print only your thumbs.
The plainest print cannot be read through a gold eagle.
You are putting on paper, in print, what you sense and feel in your mind.
There's nobody between you and the print. Nobody. It's you and the subject and the final print. And if you get it published that way, you've said it.
If print was invented tomorrow, it would be the death of digital.
Print-based libraries developed in an age of scarce printed resources.

Print is predictable and impersonal, conveying information in a mechanical transaction with the reader's eye. Handwriting, by contrast, resists the eye, reveals its meaning slowly, and is as intimate as skin.
In print, people can do anything to you. Everything you do is picked apart. People love it; they're waiting for you to make a mistake.

Print is predictable and impersonal, conveying information in a mechanical transaction with the reader's eye. Handwriting, by contrast, resists the eye, reveals its meaning slowly, and is as intimate as skin.
Nothing prints more lively in our minds than something we wish to forget.
When you print out your manuscript and read it, marking up with a pen, it sometimes feels like a criminal returning to the scene of a crime.
Fairly large print is a real antidote to stiff reading.
Lovers of print are simply confusing the plate for the food.
Print is the sharpest and the strongest weapon of our party.
If you take away print and embroidery, you have to challenge yourself a bit more on the cut.
